isis.stitle: SPICER 14-INCH (355.6 MM) STAMPED ANGLE-SPRING CLUTCH - ADJUSTMENT INSTRUCTIONS - INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCH WITHOUT CLUTCH BRAKE

svcproc.title: INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT FOR MANUAL AND SELF-ADJUSTING CLUTCH WITHOUT CLUTCH BRAKE

step1.para: Remove inspection cover at bottom of clutch housing.
With the clutch engaged (pedal up), measure the clearance between the release bearing housing and the clutch cover (Release Travel, Figure 51).

note.para: When checking 1/2" release travel, remove free travel by pulling release fork against clutch bearing. This eliminates any bearing movement.

figure.caption: Figure 51. Measure Clearance Between Release Bearing Housing and Clutch Cover

step1.para: If clearance is not 1 7/8" for a single-plate clutch ( Figure 51) or 3/4" for a two-plate clutch ( Figure 52), continue through Steps 3 and 4, otherwise skip to Step 5.
Release the clutch by fully depressing the clutch pedal.

Referring to the INTERNAL ADJUSTMENT MECHANISMS AND INSTRUCTIONS
for specific instructions for your type of adjustment mechanism, advance the adjusting ring until a clearance of 1 7/8" for a single-plate clutch or 3/4" for a two-plate clutch is attained with the clutch pedal up:

step2.para: If the clearance between the release bearing housing and the clutch cover is greater than 1 7/8" for a single-plate clutch or less than 3/4" for a two-plate clutch, rotate the adjusting ring counterclockwise to move the release bearing toward the engine.

If the clearance between the release bearing housing and the clutch cover is less than 1 7/8" for a single-plate clutch or greater than 3/4" for a two-plate clutch, rotate the adjusting ring clockwise to move the release bearing toward the transmission.

step1.para: Apply a small amount of grease between the release bearing wear pads and the clutch release fork. Repeat this at normal service intervals.
